conclusion: Understand how the position and size of objects change when the light source moves.
A cylindrical object labeled A is on the left.
An avocado labeled B is on the right.
A rectangular object labeled C is on the left.
A rectangular object labeled D is on the right.
Moving the light source backward will affect the shadows and relative positions of the objects.
The shadows cast by the objects will change due to the light source's movement.
The shadows will shift in terms of direction and size.
The size of the objects will remain the same as they are not affected by the light source's movement.
The cylindrical object labeled A will move to the right.
The avocado labeled B will remain in the same position.
The rectangular object labeled C will move to the right.
The rectangular object labeled D will remain in the same position.
The objects will move to the right when the light source moves backward.
The size of the objects will remain the same.
